class_notes: (Same as MESAS 270W 1)  The "New Jew" is a transformed historical figure; (roughly), the antithesis of the pre-Enlightenment "Old European Jew" , who was confined to pales, ghettoes and cohesive communities; bound to the House of Study (belief and practices), and deprived from participation in central histories and cultures. This course is a literary survey of this mythological figure since its inception in theoretical documents, stories and poems, translated into English.
course_description: Special Topics in Jewish Literature: Variety of subjects emphasizing Jewish Literature. Content will vary. May be repeated when the topic changes.
